dungeon tiles so real quick let's brush up on how we make these clip foundations
remember that our walls are 1/4 inch thick so we start with double corrugated
cardboard because it's a quarter inch thick and cut the center of the sandwich
but a half inch less the height so if you want your final clip to be 2 inches
wide and one-and-a-half inches tall you would cut this 2 inches wide and 1 inch
tall then with chipboard or cereal box cut to pieces to the desired size so
this one here I'm doing is 2 inches by one and a half inches of course you
shouldn't go any wider than 2 inches if you adhere to that rule then you know
it'll always fit all of your tiles including the worst case scenario which
is the dead end geometry and then some thin cardstock or even just paper rip a
strip and hot glue it to cover the corrugation notice we have a 1/2 inch
tall gap underneath and that's what's going to grip the wall paint it to match
your dungeon I keep it simple black bomb kitchen sponge to dab on some dark grey
and then dab on some light gray so to make the map I'm going to go to

add lines using your hot glue gun thin beads go slowly after painting up the
dungeon scheme paint the vines green then optionally take your homemade
sawdust flocking paint on some white PVA glue and flock in hindsight I should
have only applied glue about half the vines and also used a darker color flock
so live and learn now you won't make that mistake you can always do real
simple magic trick kits here's a bead and a clear green marble as hot glue
them together and then hot glue them to the foundation
and lastly let's do a waterspout hot glue on a bead and then unfold a
paperclip and form it into an arc inject some hot glue into that bead and insert
paperclip and chop it to length so that it's flush with the bottom of the clip
on on a scrap of card stock hot glue the other end of the paper clip and then
tease glue outward from there to make it look like splashing then coat the entire
paperclip with hot glue and sort of tease it paint up the water with blues
of your choice and before we go to the table I'd like to take a moment to thank
